title: The Top 10 Sights in Germany: How Many Have You...
text:
The Black Forest 
If you imagine Germany with rolling hills, small villages and lush forests, visit the Schwarzwald (Black Forest), where you can experience it all. The vast expanse of hills, valleys, and forests stretches from the posh Spa-town Baden Baden to the Swiss border, covering an area of 4,600 square miles. 
Walking, biking or driving â€“ there are many scenic routes that will lead you to tiny villages, sunny Freiburg and its long red sausage , wineries and old-world monasteries. Two of the most recommended tours are the Wine Route and the German Clock Road, which traces the history of the cuckoo clock . For Christmas, visit Gengenbach which becomes the world's largest advent calendar house. 
But remember: No visit to the Black Forest is complete without a piece of Black Forest Cake, with chocolate, cherries, cream and a good dash of cherry schnapps.
